headline: Contract Specialist at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary:
Highly skilled and results-driven Contracting Officer with experience in budget forecasting, cash flow projections, market research and statistical analysis. Demonstrated abilities in cost analysis and procurement strategy. Proven track record of utilizing analysis techniques to generate substantial savings and reverse budget shortfalls to create budget surpluses through market research.

defaultPosition.description: Solicits proposals from prospective contractors relating to Information technology. Provides guidance in the development of the statement of work and data requirements for brand name justifications. Plans the procurement action with technical, legal, and contract pricing personnel. Analyzes proposals for conformance with the solicitation. Awards contracts within delegated contracting officer authority. Performs contract administration activities for highly specialized procurements. Negotiates modifications to contracts with nonstandard terms and conditions. Recommends issuing cure or show cause notices when the contractor is not in compliance. Completes policy or program studies following established procedures, methods, and guidelines, and makes recommendations for approval. Advises contracting officers and/or requesting offices on controversial contractual positions. Provides technical advice and guidance on new or revised policies and procedures. Interprets procurement regulations and policies for the agency procurement activity. Negotiates with potential contractors. Develops data for use in pricing trend analyses. Ensures cost estimates and requests cost data from offeror. Evaluates contractor's financial status and profit and loss statement, balance sheets, and other financial data. Presents price information and cost proposals at negotiation sessions. Analyzes and evaluates price/cost proposals for new procurements, changes, follow-on procurements, and price re-determinations. Reviews official contract files to ensure no pending administrative action; contract is complete and ready to close; and to obtain approval of all closeout documentation. Conducts contract reviews to evaluate performance.  Applying the federal suspension and debarment regulations relating to contract management performance work statements.

positions.title: Contract Specialist

positions.description: Work with customers to develop statements of work and specifications to ensure their adequacy regarding the KC-130 J aircraft. Familiarity with the Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR). Performs customer service functions, including assisting agency staff with the creation and editing of Statements of Work and other contract documents. Familiar with contract law and legal precedents and other regulations governing contract types such as firm fixed price contracts, indefinite delivery type contracts, services contract and cost plus award fee/cost plus incentive fee contracts including multi-year contracts. Experience providing advice on adequacy of specifications, special provisions, pricing consideration, and competitive source selection processes and procedures. Develop and implements procedures to monitor and evaluate contractor cost control and scheduling systems and its supporting data. Contact offerors or contractors to negotiate prices which appear either excessive or underestimated related Naval Warfare. Determine what procurement method is more cost effective to the government. Negotiate prices, scope of work, delivery dates, and other contract terms and conditions. Utilize contract cost and price analysis techniques sufficient to gather and evaluate price. Possess working knowledge of the Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) and FAR Supplement.
positions.title: Contract Specialist

positions.description: Approval final payments for a contract.  Evaluate and approve/disapprove special payments on fixed-price contracts. Conduct pre-solicitation site visits for contracts. Evaluate contract price proposals.   Serve as a primary cost/price negotiator for contracts.  Negotiate costs/prices and terms and conditions with offerers/contractors. Forecast labor and material costs when unknowns are involved.  Utilize in-depth price/cost analysis techniques involving many different and unrelated factors and processes where there is little historical cost data or precedent.  Analyze and evaluate contractor price/cost proposals for new procurements.  Evaluate contractor's financial status, profit and loss statement, and balance sheets. Negotiate terms and conditions of a contract with offerers/contractors.  Recommend revisions to the statement of work or specifications.  Create schedules for contract milestones.  Develop a procurement plan for contracts.  Resolve major differences in the interpretation of the statement of work during discussions and negotiations. Verify progression of work by contractor.  Negotiate modifications to an existing contract.  Issue termination of contract notices.  Ensure that the contract claims have been satisfied.  Conduct contract closeouts.  Cancel a contract due to non-performance by the contractor. Coordinates contract administration activities for long term, extensive technical service contracts and/or cost type contracts. Used the Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) to prepare solicitations; and have applied agency regulations in administering contracts for service contracts and construction.  Applied procurement regulations in purchasing diversified types of supplies, equipment, and services such as construction supplies, fuel, food supplies, and delivery orders.  Posted synopsis and solicitations electronically via the Federal Business Opportunities, Fedbid.com, and GSA ebuy. Prepared interagency agreements for medical trips for the inmate
